Type: 281

Location: Iran

Shale-hosted Pb-Zn mineralisation. The Chah-Gaz magmatic complex occupies an area of ∼ 5 km². It consists of rhyolite/rhyodacite of the CVSU, and granite and alkaline gabbro-diorite that occur as elongated bodies bounded by NW–SE faults.[[1]]
